Welcome to REST API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.halthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The halthchecker function is used to check if the database connection is working. It will return a message with the status code 200 if everything works fine, otherwise it will return an HTTPException 500.

Parameters:

db – Session: Inject the database session into the function

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.lifespan(app: FastAPI)¶

The lifespan function is a coroutine that runs when the application starts up. It’s used to initialize any resources that need to be shared across requests, such as database connections or caches. The lifespan function can also be used to run background tasks.

Parameters:

app – FastAPI: Pass the fastapi instance to the lifespan function

Returns:

A generator

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

class src.repository.contacts_repo.ContactRepo(db: Session, user: User)¶

Bases: object

async create_contact(contact: ContactModel) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database that belongs to current user

Parameters:

  • self – Access the user’s information

  • contact – ContactModel: Create a new contact

Returns:

A Contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async delete_contact(pk: int) → Contact¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database. If the user_id of that contact matches with the current user’s id, then it will delete contact and return that contact object.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • pk – int: Specify the primary key of the contact to be deleted

Returns:

The deleted Contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_birthdays(days: int) → List[Contact]¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next days days.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class instance itself

  • days – int: Specify how many days in the future to look for birthdays

Returns:

A list of Contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_contact(pk: int) → Contact¶

The get_contact function returns a contact object from the database. If the user_id of that contact matches with the current user’s id, then it will return that contact object.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • pk – int: Get the contact from the database

Returns:

A Contact object if the user_id matches

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_contacts(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, skip: int, limit: int) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts that match the given criteria. If the user_id of that contact matches with the current user’s id, then it will return that contact object.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the instance of the class

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Filter the contacts by email

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

Returns:

A list of Contact objects matching the query parameters

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_unique_contact(contact: ContactModel)¶
async update_contact(pk: int, contact: ContactModel) → Contact¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database. If the user_id of that contact matches with the current user’s id, then it will return that contact object.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • pk – int: Identify the contact to update

  • contact – ContactModel: Pass the updated contact data to the function

Returns:

The updated Contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

Bases: object

async confirmed_email(email: str) → None¶

The confirmed_email function marks a user as confirmed in the database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

Returns:

The updated User object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_user(user: UserModel)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • user – UserModel: Pass in the user object that was created by the usermodel class

Returns:

A new User object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_user_by_email(email) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function returns a user object based on the email address provided.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • email – Filter the query to find a user with that email

Returns:

The User object which email field matches the given email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async update_avatar(email, file)¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • file – Upload the avatar to cloudinary

Returns:

The updated User object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async update_password(user: User, password: str) → User¶

The update_password function updates the password of a user. New password is hashing and replace old password in database

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • user – User: Pass in the user object that is being updated

  • password – str: Get the password from the user and to hash it

Returns:

The user object with the new password and a refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async update_refresh_token(user: User, refresh_token: str)¶

The update_refresh_token function updates the refresh token for a given user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • refresh_token – str: Update the user’s refresh token

Returns:

The User object with the updated refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.cget_contacts(first_name: str = None, last_name: str = None, email: EmailStr = None, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The cget_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Get the user from the token

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the contactrepo class

Returns:

A list of ContactResponse schema objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database. The function takes a ContactModel object as input and returns the created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Validate the data that is sent in the request body

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the token

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the contactrepo class

Returns:

A ContactResponse schema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database by it’s ID

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Annotated[int: Get the id of the contact to be deleted

  • user – User: Get the user from the token (Dependency injection)

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the contactrepo class (Dependency injection)

Returns:

A ContactResponse schema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(days: int = Query(7), user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • days – int: Specify the period in days from 1 to 10 started from current date

  • user – User: Get the user object from the token

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of ContactResponse schema objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contact function returns a contact by its ID.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Annotated[int: Annotate the parameter with a type and title

  • Path(title – Set the title of the parameter in swagger

  • user – User: Get the user from the token

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the contactrepo class

Returns:

A ContactResponse schema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – Get the contact id from the path

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user from the token (Dependency injection)

  • db – Session: Get a database session (Dependency injection)

Returns:

A ContactResponse schema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.current_user(user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The current_user function returns the current signin in user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user object from the get_user_by_token function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The UserResponse schema object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_user_by_token), cache: Any = Depends(get_cache), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which is a file that has been uploaded to the server. It also takes in a User object, which is obtained by calling get_user_by_token(). This function returns an updated User object.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user’s email from the token (Dependency injection)

  • cache – Delete the user from the cache (Dependency injection)

  • db – Session: Get the database session (Dependency injection)

Returns:

A UserResponse schema object, which is the updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function confirms the user’s email address by temporary token sent to user by mail. Returns True if the token is valid, and False raises HTTPException code 400.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: result and detail

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.forgot_password(data: UserMail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The forgot_password function is used to send a password reset email to the user.

The forgot_password function will send an email with a link that allows the user to reset their password. The link expires after 30 minutes.

Parameters:

  • data – UserMail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: To get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

dict with result and detail key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a valid refresh token and returns a new access_token, otherwise raises an HTTPException 401 and updated refresh_token pair. The old tokens are invalidated.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the authorization header from the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict that contains the new access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(data: ResetPassword, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password. It takes in the ResetPassword data model and returns a dict with the result of the operation. If the token is invalid raises HTTPException 400

Parameters:

  • data – ResetPassword: Get the token and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: result and detail

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_token_validate(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_token_validate function is used to validate a reset password token. It returns {“result”: True} if the token is valid, otherwise raises HTTPException code 400.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with two keys: result and detail

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signin(request_user: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db)) → TokenModel¶

The signin function is used to sign in a user. It takes the email and password of the user as input, and returns an access token and refresh token if successful.

Parameters:

  • request_user – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A tokenmodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(user: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user and sends an email to the user’s email address.

The function returns the newly created UserModel object.

Parameters:

  • user – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a single key, user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.AuthToken¶

Bases: object

async create_access_token(data: dict, life_time: timedelta = datetime.timedelta(seconds=900))¶

The create_access_token function creates a JWT token with the given payload. The function takes in a dictionary of data, and an optional life_time argument. The data is a dictionary that can contain any key-value pairs.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • life_time – timedelta: Set the life time of the token. default life time is 15 minutes.

Returns:

The JWT token in bytes

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, life_time: timedelta = datetime.timedelta(days=1))¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user. The function takes in a dictionary of data, and an optional life_time argument.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • life_time – timedelta: Set the time for which the token will be valid The default life time is 1 day (24 hours).

Returns:

The JWT token in bytes

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_token(data: dict, life_time: timedelta = datetime.timedelta(days=3))¶

The create_token function creates a custom JWT token with the given payload and life_time.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

  • life_time – timedelta: Set the time that the token will expire. The default life_time is 3 days.

Returns:

The JWT token in bytes

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_payload(token: str)¶

The get_payload function takes a JWT token as an argument and returns the payload of that token. If the token is invalid, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is being decoded

Returns:

A dictionary of the payload

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Mail¶

async src.services.mail.confirm_email(user: User, host: str)¶

The confirm_email function sends an email with a clickable link to confirm this email address.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s email address

  • host – str: Specify the host of the website

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.mail.error_handler(func: callable) → Coroutine¶

The error_handler function is a decorator that wraps the decorated function in an error handling try/except block. All errors ocurred during mailing process are printed in console

Parameters:

func – callable: Specify the type of parameter that will be passed to the wrapper function

Returns:

A coroutine, which is a function that can be suspended and resumed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.mail.password_reset_email(user: User, host: str)¶

The password_reset_email function sends an email with a link to reset their password. The token is valid for 30 minutes.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s email address

  • host – str: Specify the hostname of the website

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Hash¶

class src.services.hash_handler.PasswordHandler(schemes: list[str] = ['bcrypt'])¶

Bases: object

get_password_hash(password: str) → str¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The function uses the pwd_context object to generate a hash from the given password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is going to be hashed

Returns:

A string of the hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password) → bool¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and the hashed version of that password, hashes plain password and check if they match each other Returns True if they match, False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Verify the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Check if the password is correct

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

FOLDER = 'rest_api'¶
async avatar_upload(file, public_id=None) → CloudinaryImage¶

The avatar_upload function uploads an avatar image to Cloudinary, and returns an uploaded CloudinaryImage object.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • file – Upload the image to cloudinary

  • public_id – Specify the public id of the image to be uploaded

Returns:

A cloudinaryimage object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async remove_media(public_id: str)¶

The remove_media function is used to remove a media file from Cloudinary.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • public_id – str: Specify the public id of the media to be removed

Returns:

response object

Doc-author:

Trelent
